page.text: As requested at the March 21, 2013 Planning Board hearing regarding the above-referenced
project, Ron Müller & Associates (RMA) has conducted traffic counts at the existing Bank of
America ATM to determine current site traffic generation and an estimate of the total traffic to
be generated by the site after redevelopment as proposed by the applicant, Lisciotti
Development. Accordingly, RMA conducted traffic counts at the site during the weekday AM
peak period (7:00 to 9:00 AM), the weekday PM peak period (4:00 to 6:00 PM), and the
Saturday midday peak period (11:00 AM to 2:00 PM) in March 2013. The traffic counts are
attached to this letter for reference.
Table 1 below summarizes the existing peak hour site generation and the total proposed site
generation after redevelopment. The proposed ATM on the site is expected to generate the same
volume of traffic as is currently being generated by the two existing ATMs still in use at the
Bank of America building. The traffic to be generated by the new uses was documented in the
Traffic Assessment, Proposed Retail Development, 201 Middlesex Turnpike, Burlington, MA; prepared for Bohler
Engineering; prepared by Ron Müller & Associates; January 8, 2013.
Peak hour trips from traffic counts conducted in March 2013. Daily generation estimated based on ITE Land Use Code 912
(Drive-In Bank) daily to peak hour trip ratio.
From Traffic Assessment, Proposed Retail Development, 201 Middlesex Turnpike, Burlington, MA; January 8, 2013.
Retail plus Coffee/Donut Shop trips less Pass-By trips.
As shown, the total proposed site generated volumes have increased as a result of the inclusion
of the existing ATM traffic, which is expected to continue to be served by the new ATM on the
site. However, the resulting new trips on the surrounding roadways remains unchanged from
those presented in the Traffic Assessment. Please feel free to contact me is you have any
